intro: Sanguisorba minor var. psiloritica, commonly known as the alpine sweetgrass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the rose family (Rosaceae) and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and slender, hairy stems. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in compact clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow, grass-like, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sanguisorba minor var. psiloritica is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
